text: Hurricane Hilda was an intense tropical cyclone that ravaged areas of the United States Gulf Coast, particularly Louisiana. In addition to its damage inland, the hurricane greatly disrupted offshore oil production, and at its time was the costliest tropical cyclone for Louisiana's offshore oil production. Category:Category 4 Atlantic hurricanes Category:Retired tropical cyclone names Category:Hurricanes in Louisiana Category:1960s in Louisiana Category:1964 in the United States Category:1960s in weather
title: Hurricane Hilda
